intro: Thelaia sartorii, commonly known as the common thistleweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, which bloom from June to August. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it thrives in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. Thelaia sartorii is often considered a weed but has some historical use in herbal medicine.
